messages.content: What are ComfyUI-GlifNodes and how can they be installed?

ComfyUI-GlifNodes are custom nodes for the ComfyUI that extend its functionality for image and video generation using a stable diffusion model. To install these nodes, one needs to run the command 'pip install -r requirements.txt'.
What are examples of custom nodes available within ComfyUI-GlifNodes?
Examples of custom nodes within ComfyUI-GlifNodes include GlifConsistencyDecoder, GlifPatchConsistencyDecoderTiled, SDXLAspectRatio, and ImageToMultipleOf.
The GlifConsistencyDecoder is an implementation of openai's consistency decoder from Hugging Face's hub.
What is the GlifPatchConsistencyDecoderTiled node and what does it support?
The GlifPatchConsistencyDecoderTiled is a decoder that supports tiled decoding.
What does the SDXLAspectRatio node do?
The SDXLAspectRatio node finds the closest SDXL height and width for an image.
What does the ImageToMultipleOf node do?
The ImageToMultipleOf node either crops or stretches an image to a multiple of a specific value.
ComfyUI-GlifNodes acknowledges the use of diffusers from https://github.com/huggingface/diffusers, and openai's consistencydecoder from https://github.com/openai/consistencydecoder.
